{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3054478,"name":"Ryan ","username":"phoenix22","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/p/e19b73/{size}.png","created_at":"2022-04-28T02:14:33.255Z","cooked":"

With the season now over, what are the thoughts from teams that used the RoboRIO 2.0 (both issues/success, and comparison to RobRIO)?

We didn’t push it this year with the limited availability and timing but are planning to order some for the offseason/future.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2022-04-28T02:23:08.407Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":144,"reads":431,"readers_count":430,"score":806.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":410513,"topic_slug":"roborio-2-0-reviews","display_username":"Ryan ","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":50446,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"1899 control sys"},"post_url":"/t/roborio-2-0-reviews/410513/1","custom_user_title":"1899 control sys","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3054479,"name":"Oliver","username":"ohowe","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ohowe/{size}/221361_2.png","created_at":"2022-04-28T02:18:41.712Z","cooked":"

No issues with it for us besides some imaging stuff at the beginning mostly due to documentation issues. I shoved a second SD card into it thinking that it hadn’t come with one preinstalled so I had to take the casing of it to get them out (100% my fault) but other than that it worked great for us. However, it did not have a noticeable difference (at least for me) with the RIO 1. This will probably change once we start taking full advantage of the new data logging in WPILib.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2022-04-28T02:18:41.712Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":427,"readers_count":426,"score":110.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":410513,"topic_slug":"roborio-2-0-reviews","display_username":"Oliver","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":48874,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3729 Alum"},"post_url":"/t/roborio-2-0-reviews/410513/2","custom_user_title":"3729 Alum","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3054592,"name":"Andrew","username":"Running_nightmares","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/r/4da419/{size}.png","created_at":"2022-04-28T05:32:31.098Z","cooked":"

Ya imaging was a pain. I thought we had a doa when power was red and produced error codes. Didn’t have enough time to play with it as our event was week one so it’s an off season project.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2022-04-28T05:32:31.098Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":345,"readers_count":344,"score":79.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":410513,"topic_slug":"roborio-2-0-reviews","display_username":"Andrew","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":52123,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/roborio-2-0-reviews/410513/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3054598,"name":"Griffin Della Grotte","username":"Griffin","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/griffin/{size}/5624_2.png","created_at":"2022-04-28T05:50:33.041Z","cooked":"

Only had documentation and tool issues. Directed my students to image the RIO2 according to the WPILib steps and they tried imaging the RIO2 directly over the USB cable. This didn’t work with no actionable error message on the computer. We then re-read things more closely and saw that the SD card should be imaged directly on a computer. After we did that, things worked great.

Would be nice to see the RIO imaging tool let people know that they need to do the SD card directly if it is plugged into a RIO2, or just have it actually work and flash the attached SD card over USB.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2022-04-28T05:50:49.295Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":328,"readers_count":327,"score":75.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":410513,"topic_slug":"roborio-2-0-reviews","display_username":"Griffin Della Grotte","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":16726,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mentor & Drive Coach 5940"},"post_url":"/t/roborio-2-0-reviews/410513/4","custom_user_title":"Mentor & Drive Coach 5940","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3054600,"name":"seg9585","username":"seg9585","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/seg9585/{size}/1974_2.png","created_at":"2022-04-28T06:03:19.184Z","cooked":"

Imaging was definitely a pain, as others have said. Discussions about the SD card popping out or unable to go back in when the roboRio is mounted vertically led to some paranoia on my end about mounting options, but I’m not sure how widespread of an issue it really is.
Having to rely on a spring ejectable micro SD card as your only means of running robot code is a huge design flaw in my mind, I’m really not sure what NI was thinking with this one.
Other than that, the roboRio worked fine – I didn’t notice, or maybe didn’t take advantage of, any new capabilities it introduced.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2022-04-28T06:03:19.184Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":303,"readers_count":302,"score":85.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":410513,"topic_slug":"roborio-2-0-reviews","display_username":"seg9585","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":6078,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/roborio-2-0-reviews/410513/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3054627,"name":"Ravi","username":"LatheMaster219","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/lathemaster219/{size}/128376_2.png","created_at":"2022-04-28T11:00:37.228Z","cooked":"

Received the Roborio 2.0 within the rookie KOP tote and used it for the 2022 season. So far, no reportable issues as far as reliability goes. The SD card imaging issue (i.e. taking it out of the roborio, imaging, then replacing it) was not immediately obvious, and kept us a little stumped prior to our event, so perhaps some additional included documentation/warnings about that would be great.

Personally, I didn’t see any major benefits for veteran teams, and the new features (such as the brownout threshold) were not utilized.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2022-04-28T11:00:37.228Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":265,"readers_count":264,"score":58.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":410513,"topic_slug":"roborio-2-0-reviews","display_username":"Ravi","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":41349,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/roborio-2-0-reviews/410513/6","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3054721,"name":"Franz","username":"pureh2o","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/p/9de0a6/{size}.png","created_at":"2022-04-28T13:47:51.513Z","cooked":"

Overall, it worked well for our Rookie team [read that as no point of reference].

On x2 occasions we experienced the SD card inaccessible for RoboRio boot. The symptom was no solid safety light. This seemed to occur in matches with above average impacts. This was solved by ejecting the SD card and re-inserting.

As a rookie team, this really freaked us out the first time it occurred.

We also had a terrible time with motor control from the RoboRio PWMs. At low RPMs, one drive side would stutter, causing low RPM drive issues and autonomous issues. It wasn’t root cause diagnosed, but resolved by switching to CAN. Yeah, that was done at an event … another great ‘learning’ moment!

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2022-04-28T13:48:09.105Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":10,"reads":222,"readers_count":221,"score":94.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":410513,"topic_slug":"roborio-2-0-reviews","display_username":"Franz","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/should-we-buy-roborio-v1-or-v2/436086","internal":true,"reflection":true,"title":"Should we buy roboRIO v1 or v2?","clicks":1}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51214,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/roborio-2-0-reviews/410513/7","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3054753,"name":"Brian Wagg","username":"cad321","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/c57346/{size}.png","created_at":"2022-04-28T14:31:06.646Z","cooked":"
seg9585:

Discussions about the SD card popping out or unable to go back in when the roboRio is mounted vertically led to some paranoia on my end about mounting options, but I’m not sure how widespread of an issue it really is.

I don’t recall if it was at our Windsor district event or DCMP, but when chatting with one of the other attending teams mentors, they said they had an SD card self eject from the RIO2. They managed to find it a little while later tucked in the depths of the robot.

While I haven’t heard widespread reports of this issue (unless I’ve missed something, in which case please point me in that direction), my initial reaction on release was that the spring loaded SD card was an issue waiting to happen. And after hearing reports from a local team that it was an issue for them, I’m extremely hesitant to make the switch (especially considering I see no clear advantage to switching to the RIO2 unless forced to by FIRST).

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2022-04-28T14:31:06.646Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":187,"readers_count":186,"score":37.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":410513,"topic_slug":"roborio-2-0-reviews","display_username":"Brian Wagg","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":19532,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Brian Wagg"},"post_url":"/t/roborio-2-0-reviews/410513/8","custom_user_title":"Brian Wagg","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3054763,"name":"Joe Witcpalek","username":"wits","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/wits/{size}/110752_2.png","created_at":"2022-04-28T14:45:09.514Z","cooked":"

We had issues with the RoboRio2. Multiple issues with the microSD card slot and then then had a MicroSD card failure while driving. We saw a lot of errors in the log and couldn’t deploy code to the RoboRio. Tried Re-imaging the card (failed) and then imaged a new card and then couldn’t get it to seat properly. At this point, we pulled a “lightly” used RoboRio1 off a software test robot and put it on the competition robot. We didn’t want to accept the risk that the card would fail in a match (we weren’t sure if some of the behavior we were seeing was a result of a software error, the quantity of error messages, the failed MicroSD card or some combination of these). With our first competition days away, we took the safe route and competed with a RoboRio 1 alll season.

We’ll get back on the RoboRio 2s again this offseason to see if we can become comfortable using them in competition. I know many teams that didn’t experience these issues, so maybe our RoboRios came from a bad batch.
